Definition.desc: Defines this is an XDM file

ConstraintLists.desc: The set of global constraints definitions

Simulation.desc: Simulation wrapper containing all simulation elements. Must occur in all simulation requests.

Params.desc: The set of global simulation parameters

RequestClient.desc: Loaded but not currently used by engine

Name.desc: The name of the simulation. Label only, not used by engine.

Scenarios.desc: The number of stochastic scenarios to run in a Simulation.

InflationAdjusted.desc: If true then engine outputs (ie Operators) are output in today's dollar terms, if false then default outputs are in future dollar terms. Can be overriden at the individual Operator level

InflationModel.desc: Reference to the inflation model which is used to discount outputs to today's dollars. Not needed if InflationAdjusted is false

UseDefaultRounding.desc: If true then default rounding is assumed for all output types. If false then Rounding object is used to set all rounding.

PercentileInterpolation.desc: The interpolation method to use for Percentile operations. If omitted then uses the default 'NEARESTRANK' method, which selects the closest actual scenario.

TimeSteps.desc: The number of timesteps in a simulation. If used without tag TimeStepSizes and / or tag TimeStepFrequencies then all timesteps are assumed to be annual.

TimeStepSizes.desc: Optional container to set time step sizes.

TimeStepSize.desc: container for each time step size description

TimeStepStart.desc: The first timestep to which this timestep size applies

NumberOfSteps.desc: The last timestep to which this timestep size applies

Size.desc: The size in fractions of a year of each of these timesteps

Rounding.desc: Allows control of the rounding behaviour in simulation outputs

Round.desc: container for control of a specific rounding element

Value.desc: Specifies the value type to which the rounding will apply

Method.desc: The rounding method to apply to the value type. Can be NEARESTVALUE or PRECISION.

Amount.desc: The value of the rounding parameter. If Method is PRECISION then this is the number of significant figures to round to. If NEARESTVALUE then this is nearest multiple to which the output is rounded.

Debug.desc: Indicator to describe whether debug output will be turned on. Debug output always outputs to the same directory as the engine binary.

EffectiveDate.desc: The effective date of the simulation

TransactionLog.desc: Transaction log produces a debug log file for all transactions created by rebalance rules

LogFile.desc: The location that the output should be written to

Scenarios.desc: A container for all the scenarios that are to be logged

Scenario.desc: Specifies which scenarios are to be logged

OutputFile.desc: The location that the output should be written to

Threads.desc: The number of simultaneous threads to be used when running the engine. Setting to 0 will use the number of reported CPU cores.

RequestID.desc: Label used to indicate the request ID. Used to label engine output data points.

OverrideSet.desc: The specific override set to run in this request. Note that requests submitted via some methods (e.g. XMLRequestServer) will loop over all possible OverrideSets and run each. The RequestServer currently only runs the Override Set referenced here.

Inputs.desc: Wrapper that includes all model configuration parameters

Name.desc: Description for this Simulation Run

EconomicScenarioGenerator.desc: container for economic scenario generation objects

Name.desc: Free text name for the ESG object

BaseCurrency.desc: container for Base Currency code object

Code.desc: The currency code to be treated as the base currency in the simulation. Must be one of the specified Currencies.ESGCurrencies.Code

Source.desc: The method used to generate economic scenarios

Currencies.desc: The set of ESG currencies. All ESG models are contained within a specified currency.

ESGCurrencies.desc: container for a single ESG currency.

Code.desc: The currency code identifying the currency. Must be unique across all currencies for valid requests.

Models.desc: container for all models within a set

Model.desc: A basic load-from-file term structure model.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

ScenarioValue.desc: The Value Type(s) to be added for this model type. This must be unique in this node, the same input can't be set twice for a given model

Maturities.desc: The maturities included in the file specified as Zero Coupon Bond Prices. Should be a comma separated list of maturities, in years or a hyphenated range.

Model.desc: A basic load-from-file model, which is an Equity type model.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

ScenarioValue.desc: The Value Type(s) to be added for this model type. This must be unique in this node, the same input can't be set twice for a given model

Model.desc: A basic load-from-file model, which is an Inflation type model.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

ScenarioValue.desc: The Value Type to be added for this model type. This must be unique in this node, the same input can't be set twice for a given model

Model.desc: Extended load from file model, which allows repeating of scenarios, etc.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Can be either EQUITY or INFLATION

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

Offset.desc: The number of time periods to offset the scenarios

Files.desc: container for the files included in the model.

FileName.desc: File path and name for the file to be loaded.

TimeStepStart.desc: The first timestep to apply this file from

TimeStepEnd.desc: The last timestep to apply this file until

SourceTimeStepStart.desc: The start timestep of the input file

SourceTimeStepEnd.desc: The end timestep of the input file

FillTime.desc: container defining how missing data is filled in the simulation

Method.desc: Specifies the method used to fill data

RepeatStart.desc: The timestep to start repeating the data from

RepeatEnd.desc: The timestep to stop repeating the data.

FixedValue.desc: The fixed value to fill the missing data with

CompoundingValue.desc: The value that is used when filling data with compounding i.e. (1+CompoundingValue)

Calculations.desc: container for the calculations associated with the Extended file

Calculation.desc: container for a extended file load data manipulation calculation

Order.desc: The order to calculations are performed in

Type.desc: The type of the calculation that is being performed. This must be SCALE

InputValue.desc: The valueType is included in the input file

OutputValue.desc: The valueType that is produced via the calculation

Method.desc: The mathmatical manipulations that can be applied to the InputValue to produce the OutputValue

Value.desc: The value to be combined with the InputValue using the Method opperator

Calculation.desc: container for a extended file load data manipulation calculation

Order.desc: The order to calculations are performed in

Type.desc: The type of the calculation that is being performed. This must be TERM

InputFrequency.desc: The timestep frequency of the input file

ProjectionFrequency.desc: The timestep frequency of the projection

InputValue.desc: The valueType is included in the input file

OutputValue.desc: The valueType that is produced via the calculation

Calculation.desc: container for a extended file load data manipulation calculation

Order.desc: The order to calculations are performed in

Type.desc: The type of the calculation that is being performed. This can be either RATETOROLLUP or RETURNTOROLLUP

InputValue.desc: The valueType is included in the input file

OutputValue.desc: The valueType that is produced via the calculation

Calculation.desc: container for a extended file load data manipulation calculation

Order.desc: The order to calculations are performed in

Type.desc: The type of the calculation that is being performed. This must be DISTRIBUTIONOVERRIDE

InputFrequency.desc: The timestep frequency of the input file

OVL.desc: Level of overvaluation to be applied to asset

OVR.desc: rate of overvaluation decay to be applied to asset

MeanAdjustmentFactor.desc: The scaled mean is addjusted by this factor

VolatilityAdjustmentFactor.desc: The volatility is adjusted by this factor

InputValue.desc: The valueType is included in the input file

OutputValue.desc: The valueType that is produced via the calculation

ScenarioValue.desc: The Value Type to be added for this model type. This must be unique in this node, the same input can't be set twice for a given model

Model.desc: An ESG equity-type model. Modelled as a Geometric Brownian Motion, subject to stochastic risk free and (excess) volatility components.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

MeanReturn.desc: Arithmetic mean return for the model, in excess of any risk free return.

UseNominalRates.desc: Flag to indicate whether to model this asset as an excess return over risk free cash (true) or as a total return (false)

NominalRatesModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use in modelling risk free return component

VolatilityModelID.desc: The volatility model used to model volatility for this asset

IncomeModelID.desc: The income model used to model split between income return and capital return

UseNominalRates.desc: Flag to indicate whether to model this asset as an excess return over risk free cash (true) or as a total return (false)

NominalRatesModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use in modelling risk free return component

FactorExposures.desc: Set of factor exposures from which the model receives Beta exposure

FactorExposure.desc: A single factor exposure to which this child equity asset receives part of its return

ModelID.desc: Reference to an equity type model to which the child model is exposed

Beta.desc: The weight of the child asset to this factor/model

SpecificRisk.desc: container for the specific risk of the child equity model

Stochastic.desc: Flag to indicate whether specific risk is modelled stochastically (true) or not (false)

MeanReturn.desc: Specific excess return assumed above the Beta excess return

VolatilityModelID.desc: The volatility model used to model volatility for the specfic risk component

MeanReturn.desc: The continuously compounded constant return assumption

IncomeModelID.desc: The income model used to model split between income return and capital return

UseNominalRates.desc: Flag to indicate whether to model this asset as an excess return over risk free cash (true) or as a total return (false)

NominalRatesModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use in modelling risk free return component

Model.desc: A Equity model with mean reverting price levels

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

MeanReturn.desc: The annual arithmetic mean return used to generate returns, continuously compounded. This is the assumed increase of price levels that will be reverted to.

MeanReversionStrength.desc: The strength of the mean reversion process.

UseNominalRates.desc: Flag to indicate whether to model this asset as an excess return over risk free cash (true) or as a total return (false)

NominalRatesModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use in modelling risk free return component

Model.desc: A Equity model with mean reverting risk premium

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

MeanReturn.desc: The annual arithmetic mean return. This is added to the risk free rate as a constant return

MeanReversionStrength.desc: The strength of the mean reversion process.

InitialRiskPremium.desc: The initial risk premium used to instantiate the model

MeanReversionRiskPremium.desc: The expected arithmetic mean reversion risk premium, continuously compunded

RiskPremiumVol.desc: The relative annualised volatility of the risk premium

UseNominalRates.desc: Flag to indicate whether to model this asset as an excess return over risk free cash (true) or as a total return (false)

NominalRatesModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use in modelling risk free return component

VolatilityModelID.desc: The volatility model used to model volatility for this asset

Model.desc: An income model that divides the total return into an income and capital component

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

IntialIncomeYield.desc: The starting dividend yield, annually compounded

MeanReversionLevel.desc: The mean reversion level for the dividend yield.

MeanReversionStrength.desc: The strength of the mean reverting process of this model

Sigma.desc: The volatility of the annual income rate.

ParentAssetCorrelation.desc: The correlation to a single state variable of a parent asset

ParentModelID.desc: The ModelID of the parent model. There is no restriction on which model this is.

ParentModelStateVariable.desc: The state variable of the parent model to which this model will be correlated.

Model.desc: An equity volatility model that produces a constant volatility

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

MeanReturn.desc: The fixed mean return value CONSTANTVOLATILITYthis model will produce and store for each trial and timestep.

Volatility.desc: The fixed volatility value this model will produce and store for each trial and timestep

Model.desc: An equity volatility model that switches between two regimes based on probabilities

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

ProbabilityState1ToState2.desc: The probability of moving from state 1 to state 2 over one year.

ProbabilityState2ToState1.desc: The probability of moving from state 2 to state 1 over one year

VolatilityState1.desc: The volatility of returns in state 1.

VolatilityState2.desc: The volatility of returns in state 2.

RandomiseStartState.desc: This is an indicator where if true, the projection will randomly set the initial state. Otherwise, when set to false, the projection will always initialise in state 1.

Model.desc: An equity implied volatility model that produces implied volatilities consistent with an equity model.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

ParentEquityModelID.desc: ModelID of the equity model representing the underlying of the option on which the IV is modelled.

ShortVolTerm.desc: The maturity of the short-term option IV modelled by the first stochastic equation.

LongVolTerm.desc: The maturity of the long-term option IV modelled by the first stochastic equation.

InitialShortVol.desc: Starting value of short-dated spot IV.

InitialLongVol.desc: Starting value of long-dated spot IV.

MeanReversionLevelShortVol.desc: The mean reversion level for short IV.

MeanReversionLevelLongVol.desc: The mean reversion level for long IV.

MeanReversionStrengthShortVol.desc: The mean reversion rate for short IV.

MeanReversionStrengthLongVol.desc: The mean reversion rate for short IV

RealisedVolReversionStrength.desc: The strength of reversion towards realised return vols.

RealisedVolSkew.desc: Skew parameter relative to realised returns

LongVolBeta.desc: Beta relative to drift in 1Y vol over the timestep (i.e. without stochastic deviation)

SigmaShortVol.desc: The volatility of short implied variance (IV1)

SigmaLongVol.desc: The volatility of long implied variance (IV2)

MinShortVol.desc: Floor on value of short vol.

MinLongVol.desc: Floor on value of long vol.

MaxShortVol.desc: Cap on value of short vol.

MaxLongVol.desc: Cap on value of long vol.

SkewSmileParameter1.desc: Parameter controlling negative convexity. Higher values => more convexity in low moneyness (moneyness < 1).

SkewSmileParameter2.desc: Parameter controlling positive convexity. Higher values => more convexity in high moneyness (moneyness > 1).

SkewSmileParameter3.desc: Parameter controlling negative concavity. Higher values => more concavity in low moneyness (moneyness < 1).

SkewSmileParameter4.desc: Parameter controlling positive concavity. Higher values => more concavity in high moneyness (moneyness > 1).

Model.desc: An equity volatility model that produces stochastic volatility, either Heston or GARCH(1,1).

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

MeanReversionLevel.desc: The long term average volatility. Variance is assumed to revert to this level at the rate specified by the Mean Reversion Strength.

MeanReversionStrength.desc: The strength of mean reversion of variance, i.e. the rate at which variance reverts back to its Mean Reversion Level.

MeanReturnGradient.desc: Sets the linear relationship between current vol and risk premium. Generally set gradient to be negative to allow for rising risk premia as volatility falls.

MeanReturnIntercept.desc: Risk premium/unexpected return from the volatility model at zero vol. If Mean Return Gradient = 0 then Risk Premium is constant at this level.

UseHestonModel.desc: Uses the heston model if this indicator is set to true. Otherwise uses GARCH(1,1).

Model.desc: An one factor mean reverting interest/inflation rate model.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Type.desc: The type of this model instance

UseTimeStepSubset.desc: Ensure this is always set to false, it is partially implemented code that may crash the system if set to true

Name.desc: Name of this model instance

StartingShortRate.desc: The assumed starting short rate (i.e. short rate at time step 0).

MeanReversionLevel.desc: The long term mean at which rates are assumed to revert to.

MeanReversionStrength.desc: The speed at which rates are assumed to revert back to the Mean Reversion Level.

Model.desc: A two factor mean reverting interest rate model which takes the initial curve as input.

ModelID.desc: The unique identifier for this model

Rho.desc: The correlation between the short rate and the additional risk factor. Note this value overrides the value inputted in the correlation matrix prior to Cholesky Decomposition.

MeanReversionShortRate.desc: The short rate mean reversion strength.

MeanReversionAdditionalParam.desc: The additional risk factors mean reversion strength.

VolatilityShortRate.desc: The volatility of the short rate process

VolatilityAdditionalParam.desc: The volatility of the additional risk factor.

MarketPriceOfRisk.desc: The market price of risk of the short rate process. Note the Market price of risk of the additional factor is set to 0.

InputCurve.desc: A container for the input yield curve

ZeroPrice.desc: A container for a single point on the input yield curve

Maturity.desc: The maturity of the input zero coupon bond price

StartingInflationRate.desc: The assumed starting inflation rate (i.e. inflation rate at time step 0).

Correlations.desc: A container for the correlation Matrix

Client.desc: A container for all the person definitions

People.desc: A container for the people definitions

Person.desc: A container for a Person definition

PersonID.desc: A unique identifier used as reference to this person elsewhere in the engine.

DateOfBirth.desc: Person's date of birth. This must be populated in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

RetirementAge.desc: This is the specified retirement age. The person is assumed to retire at the end of the retirement age year.

Gender.desc: Specifies the gender of the person. This is used to determine which promotional table to use, and the State Benefits eligible age if it were different between genders (currently it is the same).

Spouse.desc: Specifies if the person has a spouse.

SpousePersonID.desc: Refers to the unique identifier of the spouse life, where relevant.

Salary.desc: Specifies the person's current amount of salary, i.e. salary at time step 0.

InflationAdjusted.desc: An indicator which is used to determine if salary is adjusted to inflation

InflationModelID.desc: Specifies the inflation model used to index salary. Only used if Inflation Adjusted is set to TRUE.

HomeOwner.desc: Specifies if the person owns a home. This is used to determine state benefits thresholds.

PromotionalTable.desc: Specifies the name of the promotional table.

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to COCONTRIBUTION

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

Definition.desc: Holds the definition of the co contribution rule

Percentage.desc: The percentage of after-tax contributions that will be made as a co-contribution, subject to the Upper Limit.

LowerThreshold.desc: Anyone earning below this lower salary threshold will receive a co-contribution specified as (percentage x after-tax contributions), subject to the Maximum Entitlement.

UpperThreshold.desc: Anyone earning equal to or above this upper threshold will not be eligible for any co-contributions

ReductionFactor.desc: Anyone earning between the lower and upper salary thresholds will have their co-contribution maximum entitlement reduced progressively by this reduction factor.

UpperLimit.desc: The maximum co-contribution entitlement for a person whose salary is below the lower salary threshold.

ThresholdFreezePeriod.desc: The number of periods where thresholds are not inflation adjusted.

InflationModelID.desc: Refers to the Inflation model which is used to index co-contribution thresholds.

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to CONTRIBUTIONSCHEDULE

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

SuperGuarantee.desc: The Maximum Super Contribution Base at time step 0. Employers do not have to contribute the super guarantee rate for any earnings above this amount.

InflationAdjusted.desc: An indicator which is used to determine if salary is adjusted to inflation

InflationModelID.desc: Specifies the inflation model used to index salary. Only used if Inflation Adjusted is set to TRUE.

ContributionScheduleTable.desc: A container for the tabular data

ContributionSchedule.desc: Defines a single row of the table

EffectiveDate.desc: Specifies the lower bound of the date when the super guarantee rate takes effect. This must be populated in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

ContributionRate.desc: Specifies the super guarantee percentage an employer must contribute to their employees Super fund.

Table.desc: Describes schedule of minimum withdrawal upon (partial) retirement

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to SISMIN

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

SisMin.desc: Defines a single row of the table

AgeBracket.desc: Specifies the lower bound of the age where minimum withdrawal takes effect.

MinWithdrawal.desc: Specifies the percentage of minimum withdrawal a person must make from their Super fund once they have (partially) retired.

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to CONTRIBUTIONTAXDETAILS

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

ContributionTaxRate.desc: The tax on contributions to Superannuation funds.

ConcessionalCapIncreaseAge.desc: The age at which the Concessional Cap increases. Currently 50

ConcessionalCapUnder50.desc: The concessional cap when the person is under the incease age

ConcessionalCapAbove50.desc: The concessional cap when the person is above the increase age

NonConcessionalCap.desc: Specifies the Non-Concessional contribution cap amount.

ContributionCapInflationAdjusted.desc: Indicator to determine whether the Concessional Contribution Cap is indexed to inflation.

ContributionCapInflationModelID.desc: Reference to the inflation model used to index the concessional contribution cap.

BringForwardYears.desc: The number of years of the non concessional contribution allowance that can be brought forward

BringForwardAgeLimit.desc: The age limit at which the person can no longer bring forward the non concessional contribution cap

PenaltyTaxOverNonConcessionalCap.desc: The penalty tax rate applied to contributions in excess of the non concessional cap

Division293TaxThreshold.desc: The Division 293 tax threshold above which division 293 Tax is payable

Division293ThresholdInflationAdjusted.desc: Specifies if the Division 293 Tax threshold is adjust by inflation

Division293ThresholdInflationModelID.desc: Reference to the inflation model used to index the Division 293 threshold cap.

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to INCOMETAX

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

IncomeTaxSchedule.desc: Describes the Income Tax schedule by income and marginal tax rate

Bracket.desc: Describes a single bracket of the Income Tax schedule

Rate.desc: The tax rate applicable for the specifc bracket

Threshold.desc: The threshold that the tax rate will be applicable from. i.e. the lower bound

PreservationAge.desc: Describes the preservation age tabular data

PreservationAgeSchedule.desc: Describes a row of the preservation age table

DOBThreshold.desc: The date of birth that the threshold will be applicable for. This must be populated in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

PreservationAge.desc: The preservation age for the person based on their date of birth.

InflationAdjust.desc: Specifies if the Tax thresholds are adjusted by inflation

ThresholdInflationModelID.desc: Reference to the inflation model used to index the thresholds.

MedicareLevyTransitionRate.desc: The Medicare Levy Transition Rate applicable between the upper and lower bound.

LowRateCap.desc: The threshold above which withdrawals will be taxed

TaxFreeDrawDownAge.desc: The age after which lump sum withdrawals from pension are tax free

MaxLumpsumTaxRateAfterPreservationAge.desc: The maximum lump sum tax rate applicable after preservation age

MaxLumpsumTaxRateBeforePreservationAge.desc: The maximum lump sum tax rate applicable before preservation age

SingleMedicareLevyThresholdUpper.desc: The single person Medicare levy threshold upper bound

SingleMedicareLevyThresholdLower.desc: The single person Medicare levy threshold lower bound

SingleMedicareLevyThresholdSAPTOUpper.desc: The single person Medicare levy threshold upper bound, Senior and Pensioner Tax Offset

SingleMedicareLevyThresholdSAPTOLower.desc: The single person Medicare levy threshold lower bound, Senior and Pensioner Tax Offset

FamilyMedicareLevyThresholdUpper.desc: The family person Medicare levy threshold upper bound

FamilyMedicareLevyThresholdLower.desc: The family person Medicare levy threshold lower bound

FamilyMedicareLevyThresholdSAPTOUpper.desc: The family person Medicare levy threshold upper bound, Senior and Pensioner Tax Offset

FamilyMedicareLevyThresholdSAPTOLower.desc: The family person Medicare levy threshold lower bound, Senior and Pensioner Tax Offset

MedicareLevyExtraChildThresholdUpper.desc: The addition to the upper Medicare Levy for each additional child

MedicareLevyExtraChildThresholdLower.desc: The addition to the lower Medicare Levy for each additional child

Table.desc: Describes the Tax details for contributions and returns

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to TAX

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

Definition.desc: Contains a simple tax rules definition

TaxDetails.desc: Contains a simple tax rules definition

ContributionTaxRate.desc: The tax rate applicable to contributions

ReturnsTaxRate.desc: The tax rate applicable to returns

Table.desc: Describes the details of the State Benefit Pension System

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to STATEBENEFITS

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

AgePension.desc: A container for the Age Pension details

PersonIDLife1.desc: This is a reference to the people object for the primary life based on the reference identifier.

PersonIDLife2.desc: In the case where there are more than one people being modelled, this is a reference to the people object for the second life. Note this is required only if the two modelled lives are a couple.

Single.desc: A container for single life details

MaxPension.desc: The maximum age pension a single life can receive

OwnsHomePensionThreshold.desc: The amount of assets a homeowner can hold for a single before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Asset Pension Penalty rate).

NoHomePensionThreshold.desc: The amount of assets a non-homeowner can hold for a single before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Asset Pension Penalty rate).

PensionSupplementMin.desc: The amount of pension supplement receivable if individual is subject to any Age Pension payout.

PensionSupplementMax.desc: The amount of pension supplement receivable if individual is subject to any Age Pension payout.

IncomeThreshold.desc: The amount of income a single can earn before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Income Deduction rate).

DeemingThreshold.desc: The asset level above which the income will be deemed at the Upper Rate

CleanEnergySupplement.desc: This is the amount of energy supplement receivable.

MaxPension.desc: The maximum age pension a couple can receive

OwnsHomePensionThreshold.desc: The amount of assets a homeowner can hold for a couple before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Asset Pension Penalty rate).

NoHomePensionThreshold.desc: The amount of assets a non-homeowner can hold for a couple before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Asset Pension Penalty rate).

PensionSupplementMin.desc: The amount of pension supplement receivable if individuals is subject to any Age Pension payout.

PensionSupplementMax.desc: The amount of pension supplement receivable if individuals is subject to any Age Pension payout.

IncomeThreshold.desc: The amount of income a couple can earn before their maximum pension receivable will be reduced (at the Income Deduction rate).

DeemingThreshold.desc: The asset level above which the income will be deemed at the Upper Rate

CleanEnergySupplement.desc: This is the amount of energy supplement receivable.

AssetPensionPenalty.desc: This specifies the reduction in annual Age Pension for each dollar of asset above the Asset Threshold.

IncomePensionDeduction.desc: This specifies the reduction in Age Pension for each dollar of income above the Income Threshold.

DeemingRateLower.desc: Financial assets equal to or below the deeming threshold are assumed to earn this lower deeming rate.

DeemingRateUpper.desc: Financial assets over and above the deeming threshold are assumed to earn this higher deeming rate.

WorkBonusRate.desc: Rate appliable to the threshold to determine the maximum amount of work bonus.

WorkBonusThreshold.desc: Together with the work bonus rate determines the maximum amount of work bonus that can be used to offset employment income for means testing purposes.

PensionInflationModelID.desc: Specifies the inflation model used to index the maximum pensions and work bonus Threshold

SupplementsInflationModel.desc: Specifies the inflation model used to index the supplemental pension

MeansTestInflationModel.desc: Specifies the inflation model used to index the income threshold

DeemingInflationModel.desc: Specified the inflation model used to index the deeming threshold

EligibleAges.desc: A container for details of the eligibility based on DOB

EligibleAge.desc: A container for a single DOB definition

DobThreshold.desc: This is the upper birth date threshold used to determine Age Pension Eligible Age. Must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD

EligibleAgeMale.desc: The age at which a (male) individual becomes eligible for age pension given they were born strictly before the birth date threshold.

EligibleAgeFemale.desc: The age at which a (female) individual becomes eligible for age pension given they were born strictly before the birth date threshold.

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to FEESCHEDULE

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

ScheduleType.desc: Specifies the type of the Schedule. Valid values are AGE and DATE

TermRate.desc: Describes a single row of the fee schedule

Rate.desc: The value of the fee for each corresponding age/date. This can be a dollar amount or percentage fee.

Age.desc: Specifies the corresponding lower bound age for each fee amount.

Date.desc: Specifies the corresponding lower bound Date for each fee amount. YYYY-MM-DD

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to PROMOTIONALSCALE

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

AgeIndex.desc: Describes a row of the promotional scale

Age.desc: Specifies the corresponding lower bound age for each salary adjustment value

AgeIndex.desc: Describes a row of the promotional scale

Age.desc: Specifies the corresponding lower bound age for each salary adjustment value

Table.desc: Describes a male and female mortality table

Name.desc: A unique identifier and name used as reference to this table elsewhere in the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this model instance. Must be set to MORTALITY

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the table is enabled or disabled

TableType.desc: Specifies if the table is a 1 dimensional or 2 dimensional table

ReferenceYear.desc: The reference year of the 2 dimensional table

FinalYear.desc: The last year of the 2 dimensional table

MinAge.desc: The minimum age included in the mortality table

MaxAge.desc: The maximum age included in the mortality table

RatesMale.desc: A table of male mortality rates

MortalityRate.desc: A single row of mortality rates

Age.desc: The age the mortality rate applies to

Rate.desc: The mortality rate for a given age

ProjectionYear.desc: The projection year the mortality rate relates to

LoadFromFile.desc: The full path and filename for the file containing the mortality table

RatesFemale.desc: A table of female mortality rates

MortalityRate.desc: A single row of mortality rates

Age.desc: The age the mortality rate applies to

Rate.desc: The mortality rate for a given age

ProjectionYear.desc: The projection year the mortality rate relates to

LoadFromFile.desc: The full path and filename for the file containing the mortality table

Factor1.desc: The weight applied to the maturity on factor 1

Factor2.desc: The weight applied to the maturity on factor 2

Factor3.desc: The weight applied to the maturity on factor 3

Portfolios.desc: A container for all portfolio descriptions

Portfolio.desc: A container for a portfolio definition

Name.desc: A unique descriptive name for the portfolio

TaxWrappers.desc: A container for all the tax wrappers within a portfolio

TaxWrapper.desc: A container for a single tax wrapper

Params.desc: A container for basic parameter that apply to the tax wrapper

TaxTable.desc: The tax table that applies to the tax wrapper

SuperContributionDetailsTable.desc: The Super contribution details table that applies to the tax wrapper

Products.desc: A container for the products that exist within the tax wrapper

Product.desc: Creates an object that behaves as an annuity would

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the product is enabled or not

Name.desc: A unique descriptive name for the product that is used by the engine to reference the product

Type.desc: Defines the type of the Product. This must be ANNUITY for this product

Params.desc: A container for the parameters that define the product

Asset.desc: A flag specifying if the product is an asset

Liability.desc: A flag specifying if the product is a liability

Investable.desc: A flag specifying if the product is investable, i.e. can accept an additional cashflow

SweepCashFlows.desc: A flag specifying if the cashflows should be swept when the sweep cashflow rebalancing rule is run

ResetHoldings.desc: A flag specifying if the holdings of the product should be reset every (timestep-FrequencyStartTimeStep) % ResetFrequency

ResetFrequency.desc: Specifies the number of timesteps that need to occur between ever reset

FrequencyStartTimeStep.desc: Specifies when the first timestep that the reset counter starts

MeansTested.desc: A flag specifying if the product counts towards Mean testing

FinancialAsset.desc: A flag specifying if the product is a financial asset, used for deeming in age pension

ShortTermAsset.desc: A flag specifying if the product is short term asset, used for age pension

LongTermIncomeStream.desc: A flag specifying if the product provides a long term income stream, used for age pension

AccountBased.desc: A flag specifying if the product is account based, used for age pension

PartiallyExempt.desc: A flag specifying if the product is partially exempt for the purposes of age pension

PrimaryLifeID.desc: The ID of the primary life of the annuity

JointLife.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity if a joint life annuity

JointLifeID.desc: The ID of the joint life of the annuity

InitialExpense.desc: The initial expense applied when purchasing the annuity

OngoingExpense.desc: The ongoing expense included in the pricing when purchasing the annuity

EarlyWithdrawalFee.desc: The fee applied on early withdrawal.

LifeTerm.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity if a life annuity or a term annuity

Term.desc: The term of the annuity. This must be populated even for a life annuity

IncomeRate.desc: The income rate of the annuity, specified as $'per annum for each $ invested

DynamicCalculateRate.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity if the annuity income rate is calculated using the stochastic interest rate

InterestRateModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use when pricing the annuity

PricingInterestRate.desc: The interest rate to use when pricing the annuity

StaticAnnuityRate.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity is priced using a mortality table or simply a life expectancy

MortalityTable.desc: Points to the mortality table that should be used when pricing the annuity

AgePensionLifeExpectancy.desc: The life expectancy used to price the annuity if a mortality table is not used

InflationAdjusted.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity is linked to inflation

InflationModelID.desc: Points to the nominal interest rate model to use when pricing the annuity

PricingInflationRate.desc: The inflation rate to use when pricing the annuity

DeferralPeriod.desc: The deferral period of the annuity

DeathBenefit.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity has a death benefit

MaturityCapitalReturn.desc: The percentage of the purchase price that is returned on maturity.

WithdrawalGuaranteePeriod.desc: The number of years the withdrawal is guaranteed for.

Arrears.desc: A flag specifying if the annuity is paid in arrears or advance

PricingLapseRate.desc: The lapse rate assumed when pricing the annuity

AgeBand.desc: Container for a single withdrawal age bucket

CommencementAge.desc: Specifies the lower bound the withdrawal rate is guaranteed for

Male.desc: The withdrawal guarantee rate for male lives

Female.desc: The withdrawal guarantee rate for female lives

JointOrReversionary.desc: The withdrawal guarantee rate for joint policies

RebalanceRule.desc: A rebalance rule to pay off a liability using specific products.

Name.desc: A name for the rebalance rule. It does not get used by the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this rebalance rule instance. Must be set to PAYLIABILITYFULLFROM

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the rebalance rule is enabled or disabled

UseSellPriceToBuy.desc: Specifies if the sell price should be used to buy

PriorityOrder.desc: An integer value specifying the order the rebalancing rules are applied.

TimeStepStart.desc: The time step the rebalancing rule will begin to function.

TimeStepEnd.desc: The last timestep the rebalcning rule will function.

Frequency.desc: The frequency the rebalancing rule should be applied. This is measured in number of timesteps.

TrackAmount.desc: Specifies if the amount rebalanced by this rule should be tracked

TrackingProduct.desc: If TrackAmount='true'. Specifies the product name that will be used to track the amount.

IncomeProduct.desc: Specifies which product the income to pay off the liability should come from

TrackDrawdownTaxWrapper.desc: Required if TrackDrawDowns='true'. Specifies which tax wrapper the draw down tracking product is in.

RebalanceRule.desc: A rebalance rule that assess the insurance need (Life, TDP and Income) and buys the required insurance.

Name.desc: A name for the rebalance rule. It does not get used by the engine.

Type.desc: The type of this rebalance rule instance. Must be set to ADDREQUIREDINSURANCE

Enabled.desc: Specifies if the rebalance rule is enabled or disabled

UseSellPriceToBuy.desc: Specifies if the sell price should be used to buy

PriorityOrder.desc: An integer value specifying the order the rebalancing rules are applied.

TimeStepStart.desc: The time step the rebalancing rule will begin to function.

TimeStepEnd.desc: The last timestep the rebalcning rule will function.

Frequency.desc: The frequency the rebalancing rule should be applied. This is measured in number of timesteps.

TrackAmount.desc: Specifies if the amount rebalanced by this rule should be tracked

TrackingProduct.desc: If TrackAmount='true'. Specifies the product name that will be used to track the amount.

InsuranceType.desc: Specifies the type of insurance. Valid values are Life, TPD, IncomeProtection

PersonID.desc: Specifies the ID of the Person this insurance relates to.

DiscountRate.desc: Specifies the ID of the Person this insurance relates to.

ExpectedInflationRate.desc: Specifies the ID of the Person this insurance relates to.

MaximumCashflowTerm.desc: Inflation rate used to inflate the required cashflows needs.

GrossUpForIncomeTax.desc: Specifies if the required insurance should be grossed up to take income tax into account.

IncomeTaxTable.desc: Specifies the table name that contains the income tax rules

InsuranceNeedTrackingProduct.desc: Specifies the Tracking product for the Insurance Need.

InsuranceGapTrackingProduct.desc: Specifies the Tracking product for the Insurance Gap.

TrackingProductTaxWrapper.desc: Specifies the tax wrapper that the tracking products are in.

BuyRequiredInsurance.desc: Flag to set if the required insurance should be bought or not, the insurance is bought only once on the timestepstart.

BuyAtEveryTimestep.desc: Flag to set if the required insurance should be purchased every timestep.
